page.title: 19LOCAL HISTORY
page.content: The original mediaeval buildings of {Bradfield Manor}are still in existence, and parts are now occupied by the Branston family. The Great Hall, now part of the living quarters, is reported to be haunted by a one eyed monk, which has been seen by one former owner of the property, and whose "presence" was felt by at least one visitor who had no previous knowledge of the haunting. { William Collingbourne,}who owned Bradfield in the 15th century, is reputed to be the author of the derogatory line:- { "The Cat,the Rat,and Lovell our dog, {Rule all England under the Hog." He was executed in 1485 for his part in an attempt to put Henry VII on the throne in place of Richard III. Bradfield is now a modern farm, using up-to-date methods and machinery.
